verses.kjv: Go to now, ye rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you.
verses.web: Come now, you rich, weep and howl for your miseries that are coming on you.
verses.ct: Listen up, you rich people — weep and wail over the misery that's heading your way.

verses.kjv: Your riches are corrupted, and your garments are motheaten.
verses.web: Your riches are corrupted and your garments are moth-eaten.
verses.ct: Your wealth is rotting away, and your fine clothes are eaten by moths.

verses.kjv: Your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have heaped treasure together for the last days.
verses.web: Your gold and your silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be for a testimony against you and will eat your flesh like fire. You have laid up your treasure in the last days.
verses.ct: Your gold and silver have corroded, and that corrosion will testify against you and consume your flesh like fire. You've been hoarding treasure in the last days.

verses.kjv: Behold, the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.
verses.web: Behold, the wages of the laborers who mowed your fields, which you have kept back by fraud, cry out, and the cries of those who reaped have entered into the ears of the Lord of Armies.
verses.ct: Look — the wages you held back from the workers who harvested your fields are crying out against you. The desperate cries of those laborers have reached the ears of the Lord of Armies.

verses.kjv: Ye have lived in pleasure on the earth, and been wanton; ye have nourished your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.
verses.web: You have lived in luxury on the earth, and taken your pleasure. You have nourished your hearts as in a day of slaughter.
verses.ct: You've lived in luxury on this earth, indulging every desire. You've fattened yourselves like cattle on the day of slaughter.

verses.kjv: Ye have condemned and killed the just; and he doth not resist you.
verses.web: You have condemned and you have murdered the righteous one. He doesn’t resist you.
verses.ct: You've condemned and murdered innocent people, and they didn't even fight back.

verses.kjv: Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the coming of the Lord. Behold, the husbandman waiteth for the precious fruit of the earth, and hath long patience for it, until he receive the early and latter rain.
verses.web: Be patient therefore, brothers, until the coming of the Lord. Behold, the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, being patient over it, until it receives the early and late rain.
verses.ct: So be patient, brothers and sisters, until the Lord comes. Think about how a farmer waits for the precious harvest — patiently enduring until the early and late rains have done their work.

verses.kjv: Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.
verses.web: You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord is at hand.
verses.ct: You must be patient too. Strengthen your hearts, because the Lord's coming is near.

verses.kjv: Grudge not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned: behold, the judge standeth before the door.
verses.web: Don’t grumble, brothers, against one another, so that you won’t be judged. Behold, the judge stands at the door.
verses.ct: Don't complain against each other, brothers and sisters, or you'll be judged. The Judge is already standing at the door.

verses.kjv: Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.
verses.web: Take, brothers, for an example of suffering and of perseverance, the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, look at the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord as your example of how to endure suffering with patience.

verses.kjv: Behold, we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful, and of tender mercy.
verses.web: Behold, we call them blessed who endured. You have heard of the perseverance of Job, and have seen the Lord in the outcome, and how the Lord is full of compassion and mercy.
verses.ct: We consider those who persevered to be blessed. You've heard about Job's endurance, and you've seen what the Lord ultimately did for him — because the Lord is deeply compassionate and full of mercy.

verses.kjv: But above all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath: but let your yea be yea; and your nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.
verses.web: But above all things, my brothers, don’t swear— not by heaven, or by the earth, or by any other oath; but let your “yes” be “yes”, and your “no”, “no”, so that you don’t fall into hypocrisy.
verses.ct: Above all, brothers and sisters, don't swear oaths — not by heaven, not by earth, not by anything else. Simply let your "yes" mean yes and your "no" mean no, so that you don't fall under condemnation.

verses.kjv: Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.
verses.web: Is any among you suffering? Let him pray. Is any cheerful? Let him sing praises.
verses.ct: Is anyone among you suffering? Pray. Is anyone feeling joyful? Sing praises.

verses.kjv: Is any sick among you? let him call for the elders of the church; and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord:
verses.web: Is any among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord,
verses.ct: Is anyone among you sick? Call for the elders of the church, and have them pray over you, anointing you with oil in the name of the Lord.

verses.kjv: And the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.
verses.web: and the prayer of faith will heal him who is sick, and the Lord will raise him up. If he has committed sins, he will be forgiven.
verses.ct: The prayer offered in faith will restore the sick person, and the Lord will raise them up. If they have committed sins, they will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: Confess your faults one to another, and pray one for another, that ye may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.
verses.web: Confess your offenses to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The insistent prayer of a righteous person is powerfully effective.
verses.ct: So confess your sins to each other and pray for each other, so that you may be healed. The earnest prayer of a righteous person is incredibly powerful.

verses.kjv: Elias was a man subject to like passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain: and it rained not on the earth by the space of three years and six months.
verses.web: Elijah was a man with a nature like ours, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain, and it didn’t rain on the earth for three years and six months.
verses.ct: Elijah was a human being just like us. He prayed intensely that it wouldn't rain, and no rain fell on the land for 3 years and 6 months.

verses.kjv: And he prayed again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth brought forth her fruit.
verses.web: He prayed again, and the sky gave rain, and the earth produced its fruit.
verses.ct: Then he prayed again, and the heavens poured out rain, and the earth produced its crops.

verses.kjv: Brethren, if any of you do err from the truth, and one convert him;
verses.web: Brothers, if any among you wanders from the truth and someone turns him back,
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, if one of you wanders away from the truth and someone brings that person back,

verses.kjv: Let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.
verses.web: let him know that he who turns a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and will cover a multitude of sins.
verses.ct: understand this: whoever turns a sinner from their wrong path will save a soul from death and cover over a multitude of sins.
